00040 /*** Define Registers ***/
00041 /* copied from shared/disasm.h */
00042 
00043 /* segment registers */
00044 #define es_reg 100
00045 #define cs_reg 101
00046 #define ss_reg 102
00047 #define ds_reg 103
00048 #define fs_reg 104
00049 #define gs_reg 105
00050 
00051 /* address-modifier dependent registers */
00052 #define eAX_reg 108
00053 #define eCX_reg 109
00054 #define eDX_reg 110
00055 #define eBX_reg 111
00056 #define eSP_reg 112
00057 #define eBP_reg 113
00058 #define eSI_reg 114
00059 #define eDI_reg 115
00060 
00061 /* 8-bit registers */
00062 #define al_reg 116
00063 #define cl_reg 117
00064 #define dl_reg 118
00065 #define bl_reg 119
00066 #define ah_reg 120
00067 #define ch_reg 121
00068 #define dh_reg 122
00069 #define bh_reg 123
00070 
00071 /* 16-bit registers */
00072 #define ax_reg 124
00073 #define cx_reg 125
00074 #define dx_reg 126
00075 #define bx_reg 127
00076 #define sp_reg 128
00077 #define bp_reg 129
00078 #define si_reg 130
00079 #define di_reg 131
00080 
00081 /* 32-bit registers */
00082 #define eax_reg 132
00083 #define ecx_reg 133
00084 #define edx_reg 134
00085 #define ebx_reg 135
00086 #define esp_reg 136
00087 #define ebp_reg 137
00088 #define esi_reg 138
00089 #define edi_reg 139
00090 
00091 #define eip_reg 140
00092 #define cr3_reg 141
00093

00097 #ifndef CPU_I386_H
00098 
00099 #define R_EAX 0
00100 #define R_ECX 1
00101 #define R_EDX 2
00102 #define R_EBX 3
00103 #define R_ESP 4
00104 #define R_EBP 5
00105 #define R_ESI 6
00106 #define R_EDI 7
00107 #if 1//TAINT_ENABLED
00108 #define R_T0 CPU_NB_REGS
00109 #define R_T1 (CPU_NB_REGS + 1)
00110 #define R_A0 (CPU_NB_REGS + 2)
00111 #define R_CC_SRC (CPU_NB_REGS + 3)
00112 #define R_CC_DST (CPU_NB_REGS + 4)
00113 #endif
00114 
00115 #define R_ES 0
00116 #define R_CS 1
00117 #define R_SS 2
00118 #define R_DS 3
00119 #define R_FS 4
00120 #define R_GS 5
00121 
00122 #define HF_CPL_SHIFT         0
00123 #define HF_CPL_MASK          (3 << HF_CPL_SHIFT)
00124 
00125 #define CR0_PE_MASK  (1 << 0)
00126 #define CR0_MP_MASK  (1 << 1)
00127 #define CR0_EM_MASK  (1 << 2)
00128 #define CR0_TS_MASK  (1 << 3)
00129 #define CR0_ET_MASK  (1 << 4)
00130 #define CR0_NE_MASK  (1 << 5)
00131 #define CR0_WP_MASK  (1 << 16)
00132 #define CR0_AM_MASK  (1 << 18)
00133 #define CR0_PG_MASK  (1 << 31)
00134 
00135 #define CR4_VME_MASK  (1 << 0)
00136 #define CR4_PVI_MASK  (1 << 1)
00137 #define CR4_TSD_MASK  (1 << 2)
00138 #define CR4_DE_MASK   (1 << 3)
00139 #define CR4_PSE_MASK  (1 << 4)
00140 #define CR4_PAE_MASK  (1 << 5)
00141 #define CR4_PGE_MASK  (1 << 7)
00142 #define CR4_PCE_MASK  (1 << 8)
00143 #define CR4_OSFXSR_MASK (1 << 9)
00144 #define CR4_OSXMMEXCPT_MASK  (1 << 10)
00145 
00146 
00147 #define PG_PRESENT_BIT  0
00148 #define PG_RW_BIT 1
00149 #define PG_USER_BIT 2
00150 #define PG_PWT_BIT  3
00151 #define PG_PCD_BIT  4
00152 #define PG_ACCESSED_BIT 5
00153 #define PG_DIRTY_BIT  6
00154 #define PG_PSE_BIT  7
00155 #define PG_GLOBAL_BIT 8
00156 #define PG_NX_BIT 63
00157 
00158 #define PG_PRESENT_MASK  (1 << PG_PRESENT_BIT)
00159 #define PG_RW_MASK   (1 << PG_RW_BIT)
00160 #define PG_USER_MASK   (1 << PG_USER_BIT)
00161 #define PG_PWT_MASK  (1 << PG_PWT_BIT)
00162 #define PG_PCD_MASK  (1 << PG_PCD_BIT)
00163 #define PG_ACCESSED_MASK (1 << PG_ACCESSED_BIT)
00164 #define PG_DIRTY_MASK  (1 << PG_DIRTY_BIT)
00165 #define PG_PSE_MASK  (1 << PG_PSE_BIT)
00166 #define PG_GLOBAL_MASK   (1 << PG_GLOBAL_BIT)
00167 #define PG_NX_MASK   (1LL << PG_NX_BIT)
00168 
00169 #ifdef TARGET_X86_64
00170 #define CPU_NB_REGS 16
00171 #else
00172 #define CPU_NB_REGS 8
00173 #endif

00176 typedef struct SegmentCache {
00177     uint32_t selector;
00178     uint32_t base;
00179     uint32_t limit;
00180     uint32_t flags;
00181 } SegmentCache;
00182 
00183 typedef union {
00184     uint8_t _b[16];
00185     uint16_t _w[8];
00186     uint32_t _l[4];
00187     uint64_t _q[2];
00188     float32 _s[4];
00189     float64 _d[2];
00190 } XMMReg;
00191 
00192 typedef union {
00193     uint8_t _b[8];
00194     uint16_t _w[2];
00195     uint32_t _l[1];
00196     uint64_t q;
00197 } MMXReg;
00198 
00199 #ifdef FLOATX80
00200 #define USE_X86LDOUBLE
00201 #endif
00202 
00203 #ifdef USE_X86LDOUBLE
00204 typedef floatx80 CPU86_LDouble;
00205 #else
00206 typedef float64 CPU86_LDouble;
00207 #endif
00208 
00209 
00210 #endif
00211 
00212 typedef union {
00213 #ifdef USE_X86LDOUBLE
00214         CPU86_LDouble d __attribute__((aligned(16)));
00215 #else
00216 #error host architecture other than IA-32 and IA-64 is not supported
00217         CPU86_LDouble d;
00218 #endif
00219         MMXReg mmx;
00220 } FPReg;

00226 /// structure for defining a terminal command
00227 typedef struct term_cmd_t {
00228     const char *name; /// command name
00229     const char *args_type; /// command argument list
00230     void (*handler)(); /// command handler
00231     const char *params; /// parameters of command handler
00232     const char *help; /// help message
00233 } term_cmd_t;
00234 
00235 /* Static in monitor.c for QEMU, but we use it for plugins: */
00236 ///send a keystroke into the guest system
00237 void do_send_key(const char *string);

00239 /// \brief read or write a physical memory region
00240 ///
00241 /// @param addr physical address
00242 /// @param buf buffer (output buffer for read and input buffer for write)
00243 /// @param len length of memory region
00244 /// @param is_write true for write and false for read
00245 void cpu_physical_memory_rw(target_phys_addr_t addr, uint8_t *buf, int len, int is_write);

00254 /// array of CPU general-purpose registers, such as R_EAX, R_EBX
00255 extern target_ulong *TEMU_cpu_regs; 
00256 /// pointer to instruction pointer EIP
00257 extern target_ulong *TEMU_cpu_eip;
00258 /// pointer to EFLAGS
00259 extern target_ulong *TEMU_cpu_eflags;
00260 /// pointer to hidden flags
00261 extern uint32_t *TEMU_cpu_hflags;
00262 /// array of CPU segment registers, such as R_FS, R_CS
00263 extern SegmentCache *TEMU_cpu_segs;
00264 /// pointer to LDT
00265 extern SegmentCache *TEMU_cpu_ldt;
00266 /// pointer to GDT
00267 extern SegmentCache *TEMU_cpu_gdt;
00268 /// pointer to IDT
00269 extern SegmentCache *TEMU_cpu_idt;
00270 /// array of CPU control registers, such as CR0 and CR1
00271 extern target_ulong *TEMU_cpu_cr;
00272 /// pointer to DF register
00273 extern int32_t *TEMU_cpu_df; 
00274 /// array of XMM registers
00275 extern XMMReg *TEMU_cpu_xmm_regs;
00276 /// array of MMX registers
00277 extern MMXReg *TEMU_cpu_mmx_regs;
00278 /// FPU - array of Floating Point registers
00279 extern FPReg *TEMU_cpu_fp_regs;
00280 /// FPU - top of Floating Point register stack 
00281 extern unsigned int * TEMU_cpu_fp_stt;
00282 /// FPU - Status Register
00283 extern unsigned int * TEMU_cpu_fpus;
00284 /// FPU - Control Register
00285 extern unsigned int * TEMU_cpu_fpuc;
00286 /// FPU - Tag Register
00287 extern uint8_t * TEMU_cpu_fptags;

00290 extern uint32_t *TEMU_cc_op;

00292 /// primary structure for TEMU plugin, including callbacks and states
00293 typedef struct {
00294   /// array of terminal commands
00295   term_cmd_t *term_cmds; 
00296   /// array of informational commands
00297   term_cmd_t *info_cmds; 
00298   /*!
00299    * \brief callback for cleaning up states in plugin.
00300    * TEMU plugin must release all allocated resources in this function
00301    */
00302   void (*plugin_cleanup)(); 
00303 #if TAINT_ENABLED
00304   /// \brief size of taint record for each tainted byte. 
00305   /// TEMU sees taint record as untyped buffer, so it only cares about the 
00306   /// size of taint record
00307   int taint_record_size; 
00308 
00309 #define PROP_MODE_MOVE  0
00310 #define PROP_MODE_XFORM 1
00311 
00312   /// \brief This callback customizes its own policy for taint propagation
00313   ///
00314   /// TEMU asks plugin how to propagate tainted data. If the plugin does not 
00315   /// want to customize the propagation policy, it can simply specify 
00316   /// default_taint_propagate().
00317   ///
00318   /// @param nr_src number of source operands
00319   /// @param src_oprnds array of source operands
00320   /// @param dst_oprnd destination operand
00321   /// @param mode mode of propagation (either direct move or transformation)
00322   void (*taint_propagate) (int nr_src, taint_operand_t *src_oprnds, 
00323     taint_operand_t *dst_oprnd, int mode);
00324 #endif 
00325 
00326   /// \brief This callback handles OS-level semantics information.
00327   ///
00328   /// It needs to parse the message and maintain process, module, and function 
00329   /// information, using functionality in \ref semantics.
00330   void (*guest_message) (char *message);
00331 
00332   void (*send_keystroke) (int reg);
00333 #ifdef DEFINE_BLOCK_BEGIN
00334   /// This callback is invoked at the beginning of each basic block
00335   int (*block_begin) ();
00336 #endif  
00337 #ifdef DEFINE_BLOCK_END
00338   /// This callback is invoked at the end of each basic block
00339   void (*block_end) ();
00340 #endif
00341 #ifdef DEFINE_INSN_BEGIN
00342   /// This callback is invoked at the beginning of each instruction
00343   void (*insn_begin) ();
00344 #endif
00345 #ifdef DEFINE_INSN_END
00346   /// This callback is invoked at the end of each instruction
00347   void (*insn_end) ();
00348 #endif
00349   void (*bdrv_open) (int index, void *opaque);
00350   void (*taint_disk) (uint64_t addr, uint8_t * record, void *opaque);
00351   void (*read_disk_taint)(uint64_t addr, uint8_t * record, void *opaque);
00352   /// This callback is invoked when a network packet is received by NIC
00353   void (*nic_recv) (uint8_t * buf, int size, int cur_pos, int start,
00354                     int stop);
00355   /// This callback is invoked when a network packet is sent out by NIC
00356   void (*nic_send) (uint32_t addr, int size, uint8_t * buf);
00357 
00358   int (*cjmp) (uint32_t t0);
00359 #ifdef DEFINE_EIP_TAINTED
00360   void (*eip_tainted) (uint8_t * record);
00361 #endif
00362 #ifdef DEFINE_MEMREG_EIP_CHANGE
00363   void (*memreg_eip_change)();
00364 #endif
00365   void (*after_loadvm) (const char *param);
00366 #ifdef CHEAT_SIDT
00367   int (*cheat_sidt) ();
00368 #endif
00369   /// \brief CR3 of a specified process to be monitored.
00370   /// 0 means system-wide monitoring, including all processes and kernel.
00371   uint32_t monitored_cr3;
00372 
00373 #ifdef MEM_CHECK
00374   /// \brief This callback is invoked when the current instruction reads a memory region.
00375   ///
00376   /// @param virt_addr virtual address of memory region
00377   /// @param phys_addr physical address of memory region
00378   /// @param size size of memory region
00379   void (*mem_read)(uint32_t virt_addr, uint32_t phys_addr, int size);
00380   /// \brief This callback is invoked when the current instruction writes a memory region.
00381   ///
00382   /// @param virt_addr virtual address of memory region
00383   /// @param phys_addr physical address of memory region
00384   /// @param size size of memory region
00385   void (*mem_write)(uint32_t virt_addr, uint32_t phys_addr, int size);
00386 #endif
00387 
00388 #ifdef REG_CHECK
00389   /// \brief This callback is invoked when the current instruction reads a register.
00390   ///
00391   /// @param regidx register index, e.g., the index of R_BH is R_EBX*4 + 1
00392   /// @param size size of register in bytes
00393   void (*reg_read)(uint32_t regidx, int size);
00394 
00395   /// \brief This callback is invoked when the current instruction writes a register.
00396   ///
00397   /// @param regidx register index, e.g., the index of R_BH is R_EBX*4 + 1
00398   /// @param size size of register in bytes
00399   void (*reg_write)(uint32_t regidx, int size);
00400 #endif
00401 
00402 #ifdef HANDLE_INTERRUPT
00403   /// \brief This callback indicates an interrupt is happening
00404   ///
00405   /// @param intno interrupt number
00406   /// @param is_int is it software interrupt?
00407   /// @param next_eip EIP value when interrupt returns
00408   void (*do_interrupt)(int intno, int is_int, uint32_t next_eip);
00409 
00410   /// This callback indicates an interrupt is returned
00411   void (*after_iret_protected)();
00412 #endif
00413 
00414 #ifdef CALLSTRING_ANALYSIS
00415   void (*call_analysis)(uint32_t next_eip);
00416 #endif
00417 
00418 #ifdef PRE_MEM_WRITE
00419   void (*pre_mem_write)(uint32_t virt_addr, uint32_t phys_addr, int size);
00420 #endif
00421 
00422 } plugin_interface_t;
00423 
00424 /// This flag tells if emulation mode is enabled
00425 extern int TEMU_emulation_started;
00426 
00427 /****** Functions used by TEMU plugins ****/
00428 
00429 /// \brief Read from a register.
00430 ///
00431 /// Note that reg_id is register ID, which is different from register index.
00432 /// Register ID is defined by Kruegel's disassembler, whereas register index is 
00433 /// the index of CPU register array.
00434 /// @param reg_id register ID
00435 /// @param buf output buffer of the value to be read
00436 void TEMU_read_register(int reg_id, void *buf);
00437 
00438 /// \brief Write into a register.
00439 ///
00440 /// Note that reg_id is register ID, which is different from register index.
00441 /// Register ID is defined by Kruegel's disassembler, whereas register index is 
00442 /// the index of CPU register array.
00443 /// @param reg_id register ID
00444 /// @param buf input buffer of the value to be written
00445 void TEMU_write_register(int reg_id, void *buf);
00446 
00447 /// Convert virtual address into physical address
00448 target_ulong TEMU_get_phys_addr(target_ulong addr);
00449 
00450 /// \brief Given a virtual address, this function returns the page access status.
00451 ///
00452 ///  @param addr virtual memory address
00453 ///  @return page access status: -1 means not present, 0 means readonly, 
00454 ///   and 1 means writable.
00455 int TEMU_get_page_access(uint32_t addr);
00456 
00457 int TEMU_memory_rw(uint32_t addr, void *buf, int len, int is_write);
00458 
00459 /// \brief Read from a memory region by its virtual address.
00460 ///
00461 /// @param vaddr virtual memory address
00462 /// @param len length of memory region (in bytes)
00463 /// @param buf output buffer of the value to be read
00464 /// @return status: 0 for success and -1 for failure
00465 ///
00466 /// If failure, it usually means that the given virtual address cannot be converted 
00467 /// into physical address. It could be either invalid address or swapped out.
00468 int TEMU_read_mem(uint32_t vaddr, int len, void *buf);
00469 
00470 /// \brief Write into a memory region by its virtual address.
00471 ///
00472 /// @param vaddr virtual memory address
00473 /// @param len length of memory region (in bytes)
00474 /// @param buf input buffer of the value to be written
00475 /// @return status: 0 for success and -1 for failure
00476 ///
00477 /// If failure, it usually means that the given virtual address cannot be converted 
00478 /// into physical address. It could be either invalid address or swapped out.
00479 int TEMU_write_mem(uint32_t vaddr, int len, void *buf);
00480 
00481 
00482 int TEMU_read_mem_with_cr3(target_ulong cr3, uint32_t vaddr, int len, void *buf);
00483 int TEMU_write_mem_with_cr3(target_ulong cr3, uint32_t vaddr, int len, void *buf); 
00484 
00485 /// Pause the guest system
00486 void TEMU_stop_vm();
00487 
00488 /// Check if the current execution of guest system is in kernel mode (i.e., ring-0)
00489 static inline int TEMU_is_in_kernel()
00490 {
00491   return ((*TEMU_cpu_hflags & HF_CPL_MASK) == 0);
00492 }
